hero.title: The Caférico atelier, rooted in Belgian craft
hero.description: From Antwerp to the estates we visit, we shape coffee as a ritual of warmth and precision.

card.title: A quiet, luminous cup
card.description: Every blend is composed to feel like a warm morning.

story.title: A Belgian roastery with a slow soul
story.description: Caférico began as a two-person studio and grew into a gentle community of baristas, growers, and designers.

paragraphs.one: We roast in micro-lots, cupping every batch for balance and brightness.
paragraphs.two: Our sourcing is built on long conversations with producers, not short-term contracts.
paragraphs.three: Design, packaging, and service are crafted to feel as composed as the coffee itself.

card.title: A space for aroma and detail
card.description: Our roasting studio blends modern profiling with hand-finished tasting rituals.

mission.title: Make every cup feel intentional
mission.description: We craft coffee that slows the pace and honours the people behind every bean.

points.one: Roast with clarity and sweetness at the centre.
points.two: Build partnerships that protect origin communities.
points.three: Design rituals that feel calm and luxurious.

vision.title: Belgian coffee culture, reimagined
vision.description: We aim to elevate daily coffee into a moment of craft, beauty, and connection.

points.two: Create spaces where coffee feels like art.

timeline.title: A timeline of deliberate growth
timeline.description: Each year adds a new layer to the Caférico ritual.

one.description: First batches roasted for local ateliers and hotels.

two.title: Direct sourcing journeys
two.description: Trips to Colombia and Ethiopia to meet producers.

five.description: Shared roasts with partner cafés across Europe.

team.title: Crafted by hands and hearts
team.description: A small collective shaping each roast, story, and sensory detail.

founder.name: Elise Van Doren
founder.bio: Curates profiles and travels to origin with our growers.

roaster.bio: Leads our roasting calendar and quality sessions.

curator.name: Sofie Lemaire
curator.bio: Designs tastings, packaging, and our scent library.

hospitality.name: Matteo Rossi
hospitality.bio: Hosts atelier workshops and community mornings.

quote.text: We built Caférico for people who want coffee to feel like a small ceremony.
quote.author: Elise Van Doren — Antwerp

ordersOne.question: How fast is my order dispatched?
ordersOne.answer: Orders placed before 12:00 are roasted and shipped the same day.

ordersTwo.question: Can I change my order after placing it?
ordersTwo.answer: Updates are possible within two hours before it enters production.

ordersThree.question: How do I track my order?
ordersThree.answer: You'll receive a tracking link by email as soon as it leaves the atelier.

subscriptionsOne.question: Can I pause my subscription?
subscriptionsOne.answer: Yes, skip a delivery or pause whenever you need a break.

subscriptionsTwo.question: When am I billed for a subscription?
subscriptionsTwo.answer: Payment is processed two days before the scheduled roast.

subscriptionsThree.question: Can I switch grind size each delivery?
subscriptionsThree.answer: Absolutely—adjust the grind in your account before each shipment.

productsOne.question: Are your coffees organic?
productsOne.answer: Selected single origins are certified organic; each product page notes this.

productsTwo.question: Which grind suits my brew method?
productsTwo.answer: Espresso prefers fine, filter uses medium, and French press is best with coarse.

productsThree.question: How long does coffee stay fresh?
productsThree.answer: For peak flavour, enjoy within six weeks after roast date.

shippingOne.question: Which countries do you ship to?
shippingOne.answer: We deliver in Belgium, the Netherlands, Luxembourg, and Germany.

shippingTwo.question: What are the shipping fees?
shippingTwo.answer: Shipping is free from €35; otherwise the fee is €4.95.

shippingThree.question: How long does delivery take?
shippingThree.answer: Most parcels arrive within 1-2 business days after roasting.

returnsOne.question: Can I return coffee?
returnsOne.answer: Unopened bags can be returned within 14 days.

returnsTwo.question: How do I start a return?
returnsTwo.answer: Email us with your order number and reason to receive a return label.

returnsThree.question: What if my order arrives damaged?
returnsThree.answer: Send a photo within 48 hours and we'll replace it promptly.

faq.title: Answers to common questions
faq.description: Everything you need before you start.

one.question: Can I pause or cancel?
one.answer: Yes. Adjust your cadence or stop before the next roast.

two.question: When is my coffee roasted?
two.answer: Each batch is roasted right before shipping for peak aroma.

three.question: Can I switch between beans and ground?
three.answer: Absolutely. Change your grind between deliveries without extra cost.

four.question: What about shipping?
four.answer: Shipping details are confirmed before every delivery.

cta.title: Ready for a monthly ritual?
cta.description: Start with a small plan and evolve it as your routine grows.
